The US Supreme Court hands Trump a sweeping victory by limiting the power of federal judges
description: The high court has restricted the use of nationwide injunctions issued by federal judges. As a result, it leaves in effect the presidential order limiting jus soli (birthright citizenship) in the 28 states that had not challenged it in court.

headline: Tens of thousands defy Orban's ban in Budapest Pride march

The young women enlisting in Ukraine's army: 'In the army, you have to show you've got balls!'
description: Lialia, Veronika and Alina are three women aged 19-24 who have signed up to defend their country. They told Le Monde about their daily lives, what motivates them and the challenges they sometimes face working in such a male-dominated environment.

headline: Trump forces the rest of the world to exempt US companies from global tax on multinationals
description: Faced with the threat of a tax war from the US government, which considered imposing steep additional taxes on foreign companies operating in the US, the G7 countries agreed to strip much of the substance from the 15% global minimum corporate tax agreement.

headline: France's ban on public smoking takes effect Sunday
description: Smoking will be prohibited in parks, beaches, bus shelters and near schools, as the government prioritizes protecting children from secondhand smoke.

headline: 'Being Jewish in France today means being alone'
description: Senior civil servant Paul Bernard shares the struggles faced by French Jews, a community to which he belongs, in an op-ed. In particular, he attempts to explain the confusion between Israel and its government, which he says does not mean 'endorsing, even through silence, the way it is conducting the war.'

description: Museums, foundations and art centers are vying to attract vacationers with a wealth of offerings, giving them the chance to make exciting discoveries.

headline: Louvre: 'We want to find a lasting solution to overcrowding'
description: The museum's director, Laurence des Cars, and the chief architect of France's historic monuments, François Chatillon, speak to Le Monde about the architectural competition to renovate the world's most-visited museum.

headline: Former French PM Gabriel Attal: 'I do not see a shared vision for society' with conservatives
description: Economically liberal, tough on state authority and progressive on social issues... The former French prime minister, now leading Macron's party Renaissance, lays out for Le Monde the political direction he hopes to champion for 2027.
